name: Commemoration of Schwedenstein iron canopy
obverse: Bust of Gustav II Adolf facing right.
obverse_inscriptions: GVST. ADOLPH. R. SVEC. FID. EV. PROTECT. N. D. 9 DEC. 1594.
reverse: The monument in Lützen known as 'Schwedenstein'.
reverse_inscriptions: OB. AP. LVETZEN D. 6 NOV. 1632. POPVLOR. PIETAT. D. 6 NOV. 1837
references: Sveriges och svenska konungahusets minnespenningar, praktmynt och belöningsmedaljer, vol. 1, #217
description: The monument 'Schwedenstein' was created to commemorate the death of the Swedish King Gustav II Adolf's death in the Battle of Lützen on November 6th, 1632.
On November 6, 1837, a monument in the form of an iron baldachin was erected above the stone by the Prussian architect Karl Friedrich Schinkel.
